what: Provides statistical tools for the analysis of vector-borne diseases in Colombia
title: Provides statistical tools for the analysis of vector-borne diseases in Colombia
text: epiCo provides functions clustering, regression, now casting, sup reporting analyses vector-borne diseases Colombia. R common health information systems.

title: Provides statistical tools for the analysis of vector-borne diseases in Colombia
text: can install development version epiCo GitHub :

title: Provides statistical tools for the analysis of vector-borne diseases in Colombia
text: examples illustrate current functionalities:
code: library(epiCo) library(incidence) library(qcc)  ## Occupation labels  isco_codes <- c(7321, 2411, 4121, 3439, 3431) isco_labels <- get_occupationLabels(isco_codes, output_level = "unit_label")  ## Incidence rates estimation  data("dengue_orinoquia_2017") incidence_object <- incidence(dengue_orinoquia_2017$FEC_NOT, groups = dengue_orinoquia_2017$COD_MUN_O, interval = "1 week") incidenceRate_object <- estimate_incidenceRate(incidence_object, level = 2)  ## Outbreaks detection  # EWMA method  incidence_arauca <- incidence_object$counts[,"81001"] outbreaks_object <- detect_outbreaks_EWMA(incidence_arauca, lambda = 0.2, nsigmas = 2)

title: Provides statistical tools for the analysis of vector-borne diseases in Colombia

what: Returns an automated endemic channel of a disease — auto_endemic_channel

text: Function performs automated data wrangling necessary automated endemic channel given method specific disease, location year.

title: Returns an automated endemic channel of a disease — auto_endemic_channel
code: auto_endemic_channel(   disease_name,   divipola_code,   year,   observations = NULL,   location = "O",   window = 7,   method = "geometric",   geom_method = "shifted",   outlier_years = NULL,   outliers_handling = "ignored",   ci = 0.95,   plot = TRUE )

title: Returns an automated endemic channel of a disease — auto_endemic_channel
text: disease_name Disease consulted divipola_code DIVIPOLA code municipality disease consulted year Year observations observations numeric vector current observations (Optional) location TBD window numeric value specify number previous posterior periods include calculation current period mean method string mean calculation method preference (median, mean, geometric) use unusual behavior method (Poisson Distribution Test hypoendemic settings) geom_method string selected method geometric mean calculation, see: geom_mean outlier_years numeric vector outlier years outliers_handling string handling decision regarding outlier years ci = 0.95 numeric value specify confidence interval use geometric method plot boolean displaying plot

what: Returns the geometric mean of a vector of real numbers. — geom_mean
title: Returns the geometric mean of a vector of real numbers. — geom_mean
text: Function returns geometric mean vector real numbers according selected method.

title: Returns the geometric mean of a vector of real numbers. — geom_mean
Returns the geometric mean of a vector of real numbers. — geom_mean
text: x numeric vector real values method Description methods: positive = positive values within x used calculation. shifted = positive zero values within x used adding shift value calculation subtratcting final result. optimized = optimized shifted method. See: De La Cruz, R., & Kreft, J. U. (2018). Geometric mean extension data sets zeros. arXiv preprint arXiv:1806.06403. weighted = probability weighted calculation gm negative, positive, zero values. See: Habib, E. . (2012). Geometric mean negative zero values. International Journal Research Reviews Applied Sciences, 11(3), 419-432. shift = 1 (default) positive value use shifted method epsilon = 1e-5 (default) minimum positive value consider optimized method.

title: Returns the geometric mean of a vector of real numbers. — geom_mean
text: geometric mean x vector, epsilon value optimized method used.

title: Returns the geometric mean of a vector of real numbers. — geom_mean
